remarks: Restriction of the base set of a derivative.  The primary application of this theorem says that if a function is complex differentiable then it is also real differentiable.  Unlike ~ dvres , there is no simple reverse relation relating real differentiable functions to complex differentiability, and indeed there are functions like ` Re ( x ) ` which are everywhere real-differentiable but nowhere complex-differentiable.)  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Feb-2015.)
